title: Authors and Citation
text: Tim Taylor. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. R Core Team. Copyright holder.           fstrcapture uses code strcapture Toby Hocking. Copyright holder.           fstrcapture uses code nc::capture_first_vec

title: Authors and Citation
text: Taylor T (2024). ympes: Collection Helper Functions. R package version 1.4.0.9000, https://timtaylor.github.io/ympes/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ympes: Collection of Helper Functions},   author = {Tim Taylor},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.4.0.9000},   url = {https://timtaylor.github.io/ympes/}, }

title: Collection of Helper Functions
text: ympes provides collection lightweight helper functions (imps) interactive use inclusion within packages. include functions visualising colour palettes, quoting user input, searching rows data frame set minimal assertion functions.  can install released version ympes CRAN : Image Le grand Etteilla, ou, l’art de tirer les cartes. Author Simon Blocquel (1780–1863, pseudonym Julia Orsini). B+W version (details) obtained wikipedia.

title: Argument assertions — assertions
text: Assertions function arguments. Motivated vctrs::vec_assert() lower overhead cost less informative error messages. Designed make easy identify top level calling function whether used within user facing function internally.

title: Argument assertions — assertions

title: Argument assertions — assertions
text: x Argument check. ... Additional fields added resulting error condition .arg [character] Name argument checked (used error message). .call [call] Call use error message. .subclass [character] (optional) subclass returned error condition.

title: Argument assertions — assertions
text: NULL assertion succeeds (error otherwise).

title: Argument assertions — assertions
code: # Use in a user facing function fun <- function(i, d, l, chr, b) {     assert_scalar_int(i)     TRUE } fun(i=1L) #> [1] TRUE try(fun()) #> Error in fun() : argument `i` is missing, with no default. try(fun(i="cat")) #> Error in fun() : `i` must be an integer vector of length 1.  # Use in an internal function internal_fun <- function(a) {     assert_string(         a,         .arg = deparse(substitute(x)),         .call = sys.call(-1L),         .subclass = "example_error"     )     TRUE } external_fun <- function(b) {     internal_fun(a=b) } external_fun(b="cat") #> [1] TRUE try(external_fun()) #> Error in external_fun() : argument `x` is missing, with no default. try(external_fun(b = letters)) #> Error in external_fun() : `x` must be a character vector of length 1. tryCatch(external_fun(b = letters), error = class) #> [1] "example_error" "error"         "condition"

title: Quote names — cc
text: cc() quotes comma separated names whilst trimming outer whitespace. intended interactive use .

title: Quote names — cc
text: ... Unquoted names (separated commas) wish quote. Empty arguments (e.g. third item one,two,,four) returned "". .clip [bool] code generate constructed character vector copied system clipboard. Defaults FALSE unless option "imp.clipboard" set TRUE. Note copying clipboard requires availability package clipr.

title: Quote names — cc
text: character vector quoted input.

what: Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
title: Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
text: fstrcapture() efficient alternative strcapture() using Perl-compatible regular expressions

title: Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
text: x character vector capture tokens. pattern regular expression capture expressions. proto data.frame S4 object behaves like one. See details.

title: Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
text: tabular data structure type proto, typically data.frame, containing column capture expression. column types inherited proto, names unless captures named (case prioritised). Cases x match pattern NA every column.

title: Capture string tokens into a data frame — fstrcapture
code: # from regexpr example -------------------------------------------------  # if named capture then pass names on irrespective of proto notables <- c("  Ben Franklin and Jefferson Davis", "\tMillard Fillmore") pattern <- "(?<first>[[:upper:]][[:lower:]]+) (?<last>[[:upper:]][[:lower:]]+)" proto <- data.frame(a="", b="") fstrcapture(notables, pattern, proto) #>     first     last #> 1     Ben Franklin #> 2 Millard Fillmore  # from strcapture example ---------------------------------------------- # if unnamed capture then proto names used x <- "chr1:1-1000" pattern <- "(.*?):([[:digit:]]+)-([[:digit:]]+)" proto <- data.frame(chr=character(), start=integer(), end=integer()) fstrcapture(x, pattern, proto) #>    chr start  end #> 1 chr1     1 1000  # if no proto supplied then all captures treated as character str(fstrcapture(x, pattern)) #> 'data.frame':	1 obs. of  3 variables: #>  $ X..  : chr "chr1" #>  $ X...1: chr "1" #>  $ X...2: chr "1000" str(fstrcapture(x, pattern, proto)) #> 'data.frame':	1 obs. of  3 variables: #>  $ chr  : chr "chr1" #>  $ start: int 1 #>  $ end  : int 1000

what: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
title: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
text: greprows() searches pattern matches within data frames columns returns related rows row indices. grepvrows() identical greprows() except default value = TRUE. greplrows() returns logical vector (match row dat).

title: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
code: greprows(   dat,   pattern,   cols = NULL,   value = FALSE,   ignore.case = FALSE,   perl = FALSE,   fixed = FALSE,   invert = FALSE )  greplrows(   dat,   pattern,   cols = NULL,   ignore.case = FALSE,   perl = FALSE,   fixed = FALSE,   invert = FALSE )  grepvrows(   dat,   pattern,   cols = NULL,   value = TRUE,   ignore.case = FALSE,   perl = FALSE,   fixed = FALSE,   invert = FALSE )

title: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
text: dat Data frame pattern character string containing regular expression     (character string fixed = TRUE) matched     given character vector.  Coerced     .character character string possible.      character vector length 2 supplied, first element     used warning.  Missing values allowed except     regexpr, gregexpr regexec. cols [character] Character vector columns search. NULL (default) character factor columns searched. value [logical] data frame rows returned. FALSE (defauly) row indices returned instead rows . ignore.case FALSE, pattern matching case       sensitive TRUE, case ignored matching. perl logical.  Perl-compatible regexps used? fixed logical.  TRUE, pattern string     matched .  Overrides conflicting arguments. invert logical.  TRUE return indices values     elements match.

title: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
text: data frame corresponding rows , value = FALSE, corresponding row numbers.

title: Pattern matching on data frame rows — greprows
code: dat <- data.frame(     first = letters,     second = factor(rev(LETTERS)),     third = "Q" ) greprows(dat, "A|b") #> [1]  2 26 greprows(dat, "A|b", ignore.case = TRUE) #> [1]  1  2 25 26 greprows(dat, "c", value = FALSE) #> [1] 3

title: Create a package skeleton — new_package
text: new_package() create package skeleton based preferred folder structure.

title: Create a package skeleton — new_package
code: new_package(   name = "mypackage",   dir = ".",   firstname = getOption("ympes.firstname", "Joe"),   surname = getOption("ympes.surname", "Bloggs"),   email = getOption("ympes.email", "Joe.Bloggs@missing.com"),   orcid = getOption("ympes.orcid", default = NULL),   enter = TRUE )  np(   name = "mypackage",   dir = ".",   firstname = getOption("ympes.firstname", "Joe"),   surname = getOption("ympes.surname", "Bloggs"),   email = getOption("ympes.email", "Joe.Bloggs@missing.com"),   orcid = getOption("ympes.orcid", default = NULL),   enter = TRUE )

title: Create a package skeleton — new_package
text: name [character] Package name dir [character] Directory start . firstname [character] Maintainer's firstname. surname [character] Maintainer's surname. email [character] Maintainer's email address. orcid [character] Maintainer's ORCID. enter [bool] move package directory creation. applicable interactive sessions.

title: Create a package skeleton — new_package
text: Created directory (invisibly)

title: Create a package skeleton — new_package
code: # usage without entering directory p <- new_package("my_package_1", dir = tempdir(), enter = FALSE) #>  #> Creating directory structure ......  #> (DONE) #> Adding Makefile ...................  #> (DONE) #> Adding .gitignore .................  #> (DONE) #> Adding .Rbuildignore ..............  #> (DONE) #> Adding .Rproj .....................  #> (DONE) #> Creating DESCRIPTION ..............  #> (DONE) #>  #> Complete. #>  #> Package skeleton created in #>    /tmp/Rtmp2zJQJd/my_package_1  # clean up unlink(p, recursive = TRUE)

title: Plot a colour palette — plot_palette
text: plot_palette() plots palette vector colour values (name hex).

title: Plot a colour palette — plot_palette
text: values [character] Vector named hex colours. label [bool] want label plot ? values named vector names used labels, otherwise, values. square [bool] Display palette square?

title: Plot a colour palette — plot_palette
text: input (invisibly).

what: ympes: Collection of Helper Functions — ympes-package
title: ympes: Collection of Helper Functions — ympes-package
text: Provides collection lightweight helper functions (imps) interactive use inclusion within packages. include functions minimal input assertions, visualising colour palettes, quoting user input, searching rows data frame capturing string tokens.

title: ympes: Collection of Helper Functions — ympes-package
text: Maintainer: Tim Taylor tim.taylor@hiddenelephants.co.uk (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: R Core Team (fstrcapture uses code strcapture) [copyright holder] Toby Hocking (fstrcapture uses code nc::capture_first_vec) [copyright holder]

title: ympes 1.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-08-20 New function grepvrows() identical greprows() except default value = TRUE. New function greplrows() returns logical vector (match row supplied data frame). breaking change: consistency grep(), value argument greprows() now defaults FALSE. Please set value explicitly use new grepvrows() function.

title: ympes 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-31 New assertion function assert_scalar_whole(). Users can now set condition subclass returned errors via .subclass argument. similar vein now possible specify additional fields returned error condition via ... arguments. breaking change: Exported assertion functions longer prefixed dot. breaking change: allow additional ... arguments aforementioned assertions parameters arg/call renamed .arg/.call respectively also shifted (position-wise) within function signatures. example becomes
code: assert_int(x, arg = deparse(substitute(x)), call = sys.call(-1L)) assert_int(x, ..., .arg = deparse(substitute(x)), .call = sys.call(-1L), .subclass = NULL)

title: ympes 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-24 perl useBytes arguments removed. now set internally TRUE FALSE respectively. order x pattern arguments switched make function little pipe-friendly. captures given pattern named names take priority names present within proto argument. proto argument missing, captures treated character type.

title: ympes 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-13 Assertion functions now (re)exported . Note prefixed dot avoid common naming collisions , somewhat secondary, emphasise intended use within functions. breaking change. new_package() now utilises explicit pkg folder R package. Fixes (hopefully) issue internal usage clipr within cc() Wayland system.

title: ympes 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-02 New function fstrcapture(). (almost) drop-replacement strcapture() performs better using Perl-compatible regexps. breaking change. Assertion functions removed. can still found internally (checked tests) intention use standalone file copy pasted packages needed. Licence change. Licence bumped GPL-2 GPL-3.

title: ympes 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-03 new_package() now add .Rbuildignore .Rproj files sensible defaults. np() now given alias new_package(). New assertion functions: assert_negative(), assert_negative_or_na() assert_positive(), assert_positive_or_na() assert_non_negative(), assert_non_negative_or_na() assert_non_positive(), assert_non_positive_or_na() assert_scalar_character_not_na(), assert_scalar_chr_not_na() assert_scalar_integer_not_na(), assert_scalar_int_not_na() assert_scalar_double_not_na(), assert_scalar_dbl_not_na() assert_scalar_numeric_not_na(), assert_scalar_num_not_na() Functions defunct earlier versions {ympes} removed package namespace.

title: ympes 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-09 New function new_package() setting package skeleton based preferred folder structure. old format assertions (imp_ prefix; e.g. imp_assert_int()) now defunct calling result error. Age utility functions breaks_to_interval(), cut_ages(), split_interval_counts(), aggregate_age_counts(), reaggregate_interval_counts() ages_to_interval() now defunct. functions migrated focussed ageutils package. version 0.0.1 ageutils identical naming usage.

title: ympes 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-05 New assertion functions require imp_ prefix return NULL success. Note returning NULL means new assertions pipe friendly implementation slightly efficient. old format assertions (imp_ prefix; e.g. imp_assert_int()) now deprecated removed future release. ages_to_interval() deprecated replaced function cut_ages(). slightly different API (see help(cut_ages) information). New function breaks_to_interval() transforming breaks corresponding intervals (see help(breaks_to_interval)). breaking change. limits parameter removed aggregate_age_counts() reaggregate_age_counts(). replaced breaks represents left-hand side desired interval bounds (.e. x value [x, y)). Intervals longer span natural numbers default begin minimum break input. ages value treated NA. New function greprows() searching rows data frame.

title: ympes 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-01 Fixes memory bug ages_to_interval() highlighted via CRAN’s Valgrind checks.

title: ympes 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-26

title: ympes 0.2.0
text: New functions working age intervals: ages_to_interval() provides categorisation ages based specified right-hand interval limits. split_interval_counts() splits counts within age interval counts individuals years based given weighting. aggregate_age_counts() provides aggregation counts across ages (years). reaggregate_interval_counts() equivalent calling split_interval_counts() followed aggregate_age_counts().

title: ympes 0.2.0
text: testing framework used ympes migrated testhat tinytest.

title: ympes 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-09 Initial release ympes provides collection lightweight helper functions (imps) interactive use inclusion within packages.

title: ympes 0.1.1
text: assertions integer, double, numeric, logical, bool, character (string), list data frame values imp_assert_integer(), imp_assert_int() imp_assert_double() , imp_assert_dbl() imp_assert_numeric(), imp_assert_num() imp_assert_logical(), imp_assert_lgl() imp_assert_character(), imp_assert_chr() imp_assert_list() imp_assert_data_frame() imp_assert_scalar_integer(), imp_assert_scalar_int() imp_assert_scalar_double(), imp_assert_scalar_dbl() imp_assert_scalar_numeric(), imp_assert_scalar_num() imp_assert_scalar_logical(), imp_assert_scalar_lgl() imp_assert_boolean(), imp_assert_bool() imp_assert_scalar_character(), imp_assert_scalar_chr(), imp_assert_string() cc() interactive quoting comma separated names. plot_palette() visualising colour palettes.
